title.narrative: OUTPUT 2.2: QUALITY & INCLUSIVE EDUCATION

description.narrative: Output 2.2: Stakeholders have the capacity to effectively coordinate, plan, implement and monitor the provision of quality and inclusive education services, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Early Childhood Development, Early Childhood Development, Early Learning, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2018, increased and equitable access, utilization and quality of essential social services for all with a focus on women, children and youth, to sustain the MDGs and address emerging challenge

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2.2: Stakeholders have the capacity to effectively coordinate, plan, implement and monitor the provision of quality andinclusive education services

description.narrative: The capacity of the education sector, and especially at the local government levels, has been further strengthened to ensure equity-focused education through access to inclusive education, establishment of ECCD programmes in rural communities, and literacy of young monks, and nuns. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2018
